intro: Hieracium sartorianum var. leithneri, commonly known as the Leithner’s hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and produces small, yellowish to orange flowers arranged in clusters. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a distinct appearance. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. This variant is notable for its genetic distinctiveness within the Hieracium genus.
